scenario:
Shares of AI chipmakers Broadcom (AVGO), Marvell Technology (MRVL), and Arm Holdings (ARM) rallied on Monday after Foxconn's blowout monthly revenue report showed a 42.3% year-over-year growth in December, primarily driven by high demand for AI servers. This news is a positive indicator for the near-term outlook of the AI sector. Foxconn's growth is also attributed to the availability of Nvidia's (NVDA) new Blackwell chip, which benefits Arm and other companies involved in AI server production.

Broadcom and Marvell, which have a duopoly as makers of custom accelerator parts, also benefited from the news. These companies have soared in 2024, with Broadcom rising 110%, Marvell gaining 84%, and Arm up 64%. However, their valuations are lofty, with Broadcom trading at 37 times this year's earnings estimates, Marvell at 44 times, and Arm at 71 times.

The AI infrastructure buildout is expected to continue in 2025, but the stocks are a tad risky in the near term due to their high valuations. A hint of an AI growth slowdown could lead to a price slide. Despite this, the medium-term outlook for these companies appears positive as long as the cloud giants continue to invest in AI.
